TopicTitle: How to fly two aircraft at once

Articles.Content:
Hello,

So I was playin around in KSP as usual and for some reason I couldn't get two aircraft in the air at once, mainly because I couldn't switch, can anyone please tell me how I can fly two aircraft at once?

Edited March 5, 2017 by Kryxal
AFAIK, there is no way to control two craft in the air at the same time, unless they are above the 25km autodeletion altitude.

You need to come within about 300 m of the craft you want to switch to.  Once you've switched the range extends to normal.

That's how I managed this:

https://kerbalx.com/ForScience6686/B-1-Refueler-WIP
If you want to use mods, you could also use BDArmory´s autopilot for this. Lets you do some other fun stuff aswell, like having one plane follow the other
Depending on what you're doing, the Air Park mod might also be useful.
This can't be done in the stock game, and so the question has been moved to the modding subforum.

Hi as the guys have mentioned  above there's no way in a stock game.to fly ,ore than one aircraft at a time, and technically it's not possible in a mod either, as you can only be in control of one Aircraft at a time. 

What can be done is use BDArmory continued, that mod has an autopilot that enables a further module called wing commander, using these together enables you to fly in formation as many planes as your PC or potato will stand,  12 aircraft is fairly common. 

A recent challenge actually needed these extra aircraft, which can be ordered to operate independently when required. 

It should be borne in mind that BDAc is primarily a weapons addon for KSP so all the functions of the autopilot and wing commander are first and foremost  aimed at combat simulations

Check out the BadT and top gun challenges for video demonstrations of the autopilot , and for numerous video examples of the wing commander in action see the thread linked below
